thread.title: Bank holiday rail strike: Find out how it will affect your journey | West Country (W)
thread.title_full: Bank holiday rail strike: Find out how it will affect your journey | West Country (W) - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Bank holiday rail strike: Find out how it will affect your journey | West Country (W)
text:
Find out which train services will be affected by the strike - and plan your bank holiday accordingly. Credit: Ben Birchall/PA Wire Members of the RMT Union are due to walk out just after midnight on Friday night for three days after talks with First Great Western failed.
It is one of the busiest weekends of the year as people make a last trip before school starts. Find out which train services in your area are affected.
London Paddington – Plymouth : hourly in each direction Plymouth – Penzance : every two hours in each direction Paignton - Exmouth via Exeter St Davids : hourly in each direction Barnstaple – Exeter : three services a day in each direction St Erth - St Ives : normal service Tickets will also be accepted on Cross Country services between Bristol Temple Meads and Exeter, Plymouth and Penzance on Sunday 23 August, and between Saturday 29 August and Monday 31 August.
Some services in the Devon and Cornwall area have been cancelled:
The Night Riviera sleeper. Sleeper services on Sunday 30 August and Monday 31 August have been cancelled. First Great Western will be in touch with already booked customers individually, offering alternative arrangements. The Friday 28 August London to Penzance sleeper will run as normal, but First Great Western will be in touch with customers booked on the Penzance to London sleeper on the Friday about alternative arrangements. Looe – Liskeard. Travellers can take the Plymouth City bus 72 between Liskeard and Looe - although this service doesn’t call at Causeland or Coombe. There are no ticket acceptance arrangements on this route. Newquay - Par. Travellers can take the 21 bus which runs between St Austell and Newquay; more information can be found here . Tickets will be accepted on all routes. Falmouth – Truro. Travellers can take the U1 bus which runs between Truro and Falmouth; more information can be found here . Tickets will be accepted on all routes. Plymouth – Gunnislake. Travellers should make alternative arrangements. There is information online to help you plan journeys and see detailed timetables and route maps .
Last updated Sat 29 Aug 2015 Read more 10 updates Bank holiday rail strike Travel First Great Western Rail strike
